<td valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">-</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="82%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Unvested at December 31, 2011</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">37,350</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">* Reflects 3-for-2 stock split effective June 13, 2011</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">42</font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="1">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">13. Employee Benefits</font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Defined Contribution Plan - 401(k</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">)</font> - We sponsor a defined contribution plan (&#8220;the Plan&#8221;). Eligible employees may make contributions in accordance with the Plan and IRS guidelines. In addition to the traditional 401(k), effective July 2010, eligible employees were given the option of making an after-tax contribution to a Roth 401(k) or a combination of both. Effective May 30, 2005, the Plan was amended to provide for automatic enrollment and provided for an automatic increase to the deferral percentage at January 1st of each year and each year thereafter, unless the employee elects to decline the automatic increase and enrollment. Beginning with pay periods after May 30, 2005, the one year enrollment waiting period was waived.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Under the plan the Company contributes a specified percentage of each eligible employee&#8217;s compensation. In addition, the Company contributes 1.5% of eligible payroll to the 401(k) plan each year.&#160;&#160;We contribute in the form of cash and direct the investment to shares of AAON stock.&#160;&#160;Employees are 100% vested in salary deferral contributions and vest 20% per year at the end of years two through six of employment in employer matching contributions.&#160;&#160;For the year ended December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009 we made matching contributions of $2.2 million, $1.7 million and $1.2 million, respectively. Administrative expenses were approximately $0.108 million, $0.097 million and $0.081 million for the years ended 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Profit Sharing Bonus Plan</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"> - </font>We maintain a discretionary profit sharing bonus plan under which 10% of pre-tax profit is paid to eligible employees on a quarterly basis in order to reward employee productivity.&#160;&#160;Eligible employees are regular full-time employees who are actively employed and working on the first day of the calendar quarter and remain continuously, actively employed and working on the last day of the quarter and who work at least 80% of the quarter. Profit sharing expense was $2.4 million, $3.8 million and $4.8 million for the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">14</font>.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Shareholders&#8217; Equity</font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stockholder Rights Plan -</font> During 1999, the Board of Directors adopted a Stockholder Rights Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;), which was amended in 2002.&#160;&#160;Under the Plan, stockholders of record on March 1, 1999, received a dividend of one right per share of our Common Stock.&#160;&#160;Stock issued after March 1, 1999, contains a notation incorporating the rights.&#160;&#160;Each right entitles the holder to purchase one one-thousandth (1/1,000) of a share of Series A Preferred Stock at an exercise price of $90.&#160;&#160;The rights are traded with our Common Stock.&#160;&#160;The rights become exercisable after a person has acquired, or a tender offer is made for, 15% or more of our Common Stock.&#160;&#160;If either of these events occurs, upon exercise the holder (other than a holder owning more than 15% of the outstanding stock) will receive the number of shares of our Common Stock having a market value equal to two times the exercise price.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The rights may be redeemed by us for $0.001 per right until a person or group has acquired 15% of our Common Stock.&#160;&#160;The rights expire on August 20, 2012.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Repurchase</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"> - </font>On May 12, 2010, we completed a stock buyback program under a Board of Directors authorization dated November 6, 2007.&#160;&#160;As authorized we repurchased a total of 2.7 million shares under this program for an aggregate price of approximately $36.1 million, or an average price of $13.36 per share.&#160;&#160;We purchased these shares at current market prices.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 17, 2010, the Board authorized a new stock buyback program, targeting repurchases of up to approximately 5% (approximately 1.3 million shares) of our outstanding stock from time to time in open market transactions.&#160;&#160;Through June 28, 2010, we repurchased a total of approximately 0.718 million shares for an aggregate price of $11.5 million, or an average price of $16.04 per share.&#160;&#160;We purchased the shares at current market prices.&#160;&#160;No purchases were made during 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On July 1, 2005, we entered into a stock repurchase arrangement by which employee participants in our 401(k) savings and investment plan are entitled to have shares of AAON stock in their accounts sold to us to provide diversification of their investments.&#160;&#160;The maximum number of shares to be repurchased is not known under the program as the amount is contingent on the number of shares sold by employees. Through December 31, 2011, we repurchased 1.7 million shares for an aggregate price of $21.5 million or an average price of $12.71 per share. We purchased the shares at current market prices.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">43</font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="1">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On November 7, 2006, the Board of Directors authorized us to repurchase shares from certain directors and officers following their exercise of stock options.&#160;&#160;The maximum number of shares to be repurchased under the program is not known as the amount is contingent on the number of shares sold.&#160;&#160;Through December 31, 2011, we repurchased 579,625 shares for an aggregate price of $8.1 million or an average price of $13.98 per share.&#160;&#160;We purchased the shares at current market prices.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Dividends - </font>At the discretion of the Board of Directors we pay semi-annual cash dividends. Board approval is required to determine the date of declaration and amount for each semi-annual dividend payment. The Board of Directors approved dividend payments of $0.12 per share related to the 3-for-2 stock split effective on June 13, 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During 2011 we declared dividends to shareholders of record at the close of business on June 10, 2011 and December 1, 2011 which were paid on July 1, 2011 and December 22, 2011, respectively.&#160;&#160;We paid cash dividends of $5.9 million, $9.2 million, and $5.9 million in 2011, 2010, and 2009, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">15.&#160;&#160;Commitments and Contingencies</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are subject to various claims and legal actions that arise in the ordinary course of business. We closely monitor these claims and legal actions and frequently consult with our legal counsel to determine whether they may, when resolved, have a material adverse effect on our financial position or results of operations and accrue and/or disclose loss contingencies as appropriate.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are party to several short-term, cancelable and occasionally non-cancelable, fixed price contracts with major suppliers for the purchase of raw material and component parts. We expect to receive delivery of raw materials for use in our manufacturing operations.&#160;&#160;These contracts are not accounted for as derivative instruments because they meet the normal purchases and sales exemption.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">16. Earnings Per Share</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Basic net income per share is calculated by dividing net income by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the period. Diluted net income per share assumes the conversion of all potentially dilutive securities and is calculated by dividing net income by the sum of the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding plus all potentially dilutive securities. Dilutive common shares consist primarily of stock options and restricted stock awards.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted earnings per share:</font><br>
</div>

</td>

<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Exhibit 23</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have issued our reports dated March 14, 2012, with respect to the consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting included in the Annual Report of AAON, Inc. on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2011. We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference of said reports in the Registration Statements of AAON, Inc. on Forms S-8 (File No. 333-52824, effective December 28, 2000 and File No. 333-151915, effective June 25, 2008).</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">/s/ GRANT THORNTON LLP</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Tulsa, Oklahoma</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">March 14, 2012</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Exhibit 31.1</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Norman H. Asbjornson, certify that:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of AAON, Inc.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including our consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">b)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">c)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal controls over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">b)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</font></div>

</td>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">c)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">d)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal controls over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">b)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
<div align="center">&#160;</div>

    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;1.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Business Description&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;AAON, Inc. is a Nevada corporation&#13;which was incorporated on August 18, 1987.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Our operating subsidiaries include AAON, Inc., an Oklahoma corporation and&#13;AAON Coil Products, Inc., a Texas corporation. The Consolidated Financial Statements include our accounts and the accounts of our&#13;subsidiaries.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Unless the context otherwise requires, references in this Annual Report to &amp;#8220;AAON,&amp;#8221; the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;,&#13;&amp;#8220;we,&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;us,&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;our&amp;#8221; or &amp;#8220;ours&amp;#8221; refer to AAON, Inc., and our subsidiaries.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We are engaged in the manufacture&#13;and sale of air conditioning and heating equipment consisting of rooftop units, chillers, air-handling units, make-up air units,&#13;heat recovery units, condensing units and coils.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Summary of&#13;Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;These financial statements are&#13;prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. The accompanying consolidated&#13;financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. All significant intercompany accounts&#13;and transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We consider all highly liquid&#13;temporary investments with original maturity dates of three months or less to be cash equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents consist&#13;of bank deposits and highly liquid, interest-bearing money market funds.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Investments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Investments with a maturity&#13;of greater than three months to one year are classified as short-term investments. Investments with maturities beyond one year&#13;may be classified as short-term if we reasonably expect the investment to be realized in cash or sold or consumed during the normal&#13;operating cycle of the business; otherwise, they are classified as long-term. Investments available for sale are recorded at market&#13;value.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Investments held to maturity are measured at amortized cost in the consolidated balance sheets if it is our intent&#13;and ability to hold those securities to maturity. Any unrealized gains and losses on available for sale securities are reported&#13;as other comprehensive income (loss) as a separate component of stockholders&amp;#8217; equity until realized or until a decline in&#13;fair value is determined to be other than temporary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We have no outstanding investments&#13;in certificates of deposit and corporate notes and bonds at December 31, 2011. At December 31, 2010 investments in certificates&#13;of deposits and corporate notes and bonds amounted to $1.5 million and $9.5 million, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts and Notes Receivable&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Accounts and notes receivable&#13;are stated at amounts due from customers, net of an allowance for doubtful accounts.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We generally do not require that&#13;our customers provide collateral. The Company determines its allowance for doubtful accounts by considering a number of factors,&#13;including the credit risk of specific customers, the customer&amp;#8217;s ability to pay current obligations, historical trends, economic&#13;and market conditions and the age of the receivable.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accounts are considered past due when the balance has been outstanding&#13;for greater than ninety days.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Past due accounts are generally written-off against the allowance for doubtful accounts&#13;only after all collection attempts have been exhausted.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Our customers are concentrated&#13;primarily in the domestic commercial and industrial new construction and replacement markets.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;To date, our sales have&#13;been primarily to the domestic market, with foreign sales accounting for approximately 5% of revenues for the years ended December&#13;31, 2011 and 2010.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;No customer accounted for 10% of our sales during 2011, 2010 or 2009 or more than 5% of our accounts&#13;receivable balance at December 31, 2011 or 2010.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Financial&#13;Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The carrying amounts of cash&#13;and cash equivalents, receivables, accounts payable and accrued expenses approximate fair value because of the short-term maturity&#13;of the items.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The carrying amount of the Company's revolving line of credit, and other payables, approximate their fair&#13;values either due to their short term nature, the variable rates associated with the debt or based on current rates offered to&#13;the Company for debt with similar characteristics.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;See Note 10 for further detail about fair market value.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Inventories&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Inventories are valued at&#13;the lower of cost or market using the first-in, first-out (&amp;#8220;FIFO&amp;#8221;) method. Cost in inventory includes purchased parts&#13;and materials, direct labor and applied manufacturing overhead. We establish an allowance for excess and obsolete inventories based&#13;on product line changes, the feasibility of substituting parts and the need for supply and replacement parts.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Property, Plant and Equipment&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Property, plant and equipment,&#13;including significant improvements, are recorded at cost, net of accumulated depreciation. Repairs and maintenance and any gains&#13;or losses on disposition are included in operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Depreciation is computed&#13;using the straight-line method over the following estimated useful lives:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: times new roman"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 78%; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;Buildings&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 22%; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;10-40 years&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;Machinery and equipment&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;3-15 years&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;Furniture and fixtures&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;2-5 years&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived&#13;Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We periodically review long-lived&#13;assets for possible impairment when events or changes in circumstances indicate, in management&amp;#8217;s judgment, that the carrying&#13;amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset or asset&#13;group to its estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset or asset group. If the undiscounted&#13;cash flows are less than the carrying amount of the asset or asset group, an impairment loss is recognized for the amount by which&#13;the carrying amount of the asset or asset group exceeds its fair value.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Research and Development&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The costs associated with research&#13;and development for the purpose of developing and improving new products are expensed as incurred. For the years ended December&#13;31, 2011, 2010, and 2009 research and development costs amounted to approximately $4.8 million, $3.6 million, and $3.1 million,&#13;respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Advertising&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Advertising costs are expensed&#13;as incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Advertising expense for the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010, and 2009 was approximately $1.2 million,&#13;$0.877 million and $0.761 million respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Shipping and Handling&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We incur shipping and handling&#13;costs in the distribution of products sold that are recorded in cost of sales.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Shipping charges that are billed to the&#13;customer are recorded in revenues and as an expense in cost of sales. For the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009 shipping&#13;and handling fees amounted to approximately $8.7 million, $8.6 million, and $10.2 million, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Income taxes are accounted&#13;for under the asset and liability method. The Company recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax&#13;consequences of temporary differences between the book carrying amounts and the tax basis of assets and liabilities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We&#13;establish accruals for uncertain tax positions when it is more likely than not that our tax return positions may not be fully sustained.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;Company records a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets when, in the opinion of management, it is more likely than not that&#13;deferred tax assets will not be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock Compensation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company recognizes expense&#13;for its share-based compensation based on the fair value of the awards that are granted. The Company&amp;#8217;s share-based compensation&#13;plans provide for the granting of stock options, and restricted stock. The fair values of stock options are estimated at the date&#13;of grant using the Black-Scholes option valuation model. The use of the Black-Scholes option valuation model requires the input&#13;of subjective assumptions. Measured compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures, is recognized ratably over the vesting period&#13;of the related share-based compensation award. The fair value of restricted stock awards is determined based on the market value&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s shares on the grant date and the compensation expense is recognized on a straight-line basis during the&#13;service period of the respective grant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Financial Derivatives&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company occasionally uses&#13;derivative financial instruments to reduce its exposure to the risk of increasing commodity prices. Contract terms of the hedging&#13;instrument closely mirror those of the hedged forecasted transaction providing for the hedge relationship to be highly effective&#13;both at inception and continuously throughout the term of the hedging relationship. The Company does not engage in speculative&#13;transactions, nor does the Company hold or issue financial instruments for trading purposes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company recognizes all derivatives&#13;on the balance sheets at fair value. Derivatives that do not meet the criteria for hedge accounting are adjusted to fair value&#13;through income. If the derivative is designated as a cash flow hedge, changes in the fair value are recognized in accumulated other&#13;comprehensive income (loss) until the hedged transaction is recognized in income. If a hedging instrument is terminated, any unrealized&#13;gain (loss) at the date of termination is carried in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) until the hedged transaction&#13;is recognized in income. The ineffective portion of a derivative&amp;#8217;s change in fair value is recognized in income in the period&#13;of change.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We recognize revenues from&#13;sales of products when the products are shipped and the title and risk of ownership pass to the customer.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Final sales&#13;prices are fixed based on purchase orders.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Sales allowances and customer incentives are treated as reductions to sales&#13;and are provided for based on historical experiences and current estimates.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Our policy is to record the collection and&#13;payment of sales taxes through a liability account.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We present revenues net of certain&#13;payments to our independent manufacturer representatives (&amp;#8220;Representatives&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; Representatives are national companies&#13;that are in the business of providing HVAC units and other related products and services to customers.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The end user&#13;customer orders a bundled group of products and services from the Representative and expects the Representative to fulfill the&#13;order.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Only after the specifications are agreed to by the Representative and the customer, and the decision is made&#13;to use an AAON HVAC unit, will we receive notice of the order.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We establish the amount we must receive for our HVAC&#13;unit (&amp;#8220;minimum sales price&amp;#8221;), but do not control the total order price which is negotiated by the Representative with&#13;the end user customer.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We are responsible for billings&#13;and collections resulting from all sales transactions, including those initiated by our Representatives.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Representatives&#13;submit the total order price to us for invoicing and collection.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The total order price includes our minimum sales price&#13;and an additional amount which may include both the Representatives&amp;#8217; fee and amounts due for additional products and services&#13;required by the customer.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These additional products and services may include controls purchased from another manufacturer&#13;to operate the unit, start-up services, and curbs for supporting the unit (&amp;#8220;Third Party Products&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All&#13;are associated with the purchase of a HVAC unit but may be provided by the Representative or another third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;Company is under no obligation related to Third Party Products.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Representatives do not provide&#13;us with a break-out of the amount of the total order price over the minimum sales price which includes the Representatives&amp;#8217;&#13;fee and Third Party Product amounts (&amp;#8220;Due to Representatives&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Due to Representatives amount is paid&#13;only after all amounts associated with the order are collected from the customer.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The amount of payments to our representatives&#13;was $51.6 million, $51.4 million and $58.0 million for the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010, and 2009, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Insurance Reserves&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Under the Company&amp;#8217;s insurance&#13;programs, coverage is obtained for significant liability limits as well as those risks required to be insured by law or contract.&#13;It is the policy of the Company to self-insure a portion of certain expected losses related primarily to workers&amp;#8217; compensation&#13;and medical liability. Provisions for losses expected under these programs are recorded based on the Company&amp;#8217;s estimates&#13;of the aggregate liabilities for the claims incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Product Warranties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A provision is made for&#13;the estimated cost of maintaining product warranties to customers at the time the product is sold based upon historical claims&#13;experience by product line. The Company records a liability and an expense for estimated future warranty claims based upon historical&#13;experience and management's estimate of the level of future claims.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Changes in the estimated amounts recognized in&#13;prior years are recorded as an adjustment to the liability and expense in the current year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The preparation of financial&#13;statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States requires management to make estimates&#13;and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities&#13;at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Because&#13;these estimates and assumptions require significant judgment, future actual results could differ from those estimates and could&#13;have a significant impact on our results of operations, financial position and cash flows.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We reevaluate our estimates&#13;and assumptions on a monthly basis. The most significant estimates include the allowance for doubtful accounts, inventory reserves,&#13;warranty accrual, medical insurance accrual, share-based compensation and the fair value of derivative financial instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual&#13;results could differ materially from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Certain amounts have been&#13;reclassified from the prior year presentation to conform to the current year presentation with no impact to reported net income&#13;or stockholders&amp;#8217; equity.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:LoansNotesTradeAndOtherReceivablesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;3. Accounts Receivable&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Accounts receivable and the&#13;related allowance for doubtful accounts are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: times new roman"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="6" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;December 31,&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left; font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2px; font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;2011&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; text-align: left; font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;2010&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2px; font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-style: italic"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="6" style="font-style: italic; text-align: center; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;(in thousands)&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left; font-style: italic"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: #cceeff; vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left; width: 68%; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;Accounts receivable&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 12%; text-align: right"&gt;34,405&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 2%; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; width: 2%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 12%; text-align: right"&gt;40,501&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: white; vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left;     <aaon:NoteReceivableDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;5.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Note Receivable&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In connection with the closure&#13;of our Canadian facility on May 18, 2009 we sold land and a building in September 2010 and assumed a note receivable from the borrower&#13;secured by the property. The $1.1 million, fifteen-year note has an interest rate of 4.0% and is payable to us monthly, and has&#13;a $0.6 million balloon payment due in October 2025.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Interest payments are recognized in interest income.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;We evaluate the note for&#13;impairment on a quarterly basis.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We determine the note receivable to be impaired if we are uncertain of its collectability&#13;based on the contractual terms.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At December 31, 2011 and 2010 there was no impairment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</aaon:NoteReceivableDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashFlowSupplementalDisclosuresTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;6.&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;b&gt;Supplemental&#13;Cash Flow Information&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Cash paid for interest payments&#13;were approximately $0.277 million, $0.045 million, and $0.009 million for the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Payments&#13;for income taxes were $6.4 million, $7.8 million and $10.0 million for the years ended December&amp;#160;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Capital expenditures amounted&#13;to $39.8 million, $17.5 million and $9.8 million in 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively. At December 31, 2011, $3.9 million of capital&#13;expenditures are accrued in accounts payable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;For the year ended December&#13;31, 2011 we incurred a loss of approximately $1.8 million from the trade-in of production equipment. This equipment was replaced&#13;with new state of the art equipment that combines the latest advancement in automation and laser technology as a result of our&#13;strategic vision to improve our current manufacturing efficiencies.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashFlowSupplementalDisclosuresTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ProductWarrantyDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;7. Warranties&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A provision is made for estimated&#13;warranty costs at the time the related products are sold based upon the warranty period, historical trends, new products and any&#13;known identifiable warranty issues.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Warranty expense was $4.2 million, $4.5 million and $4.8 million for the years ended&#13;December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Changes in the warranty accrual&#13;during the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010 and 2009 are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; text-align: left"&gt;)&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; border-bottom: black 2px solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2px solid; text-align: right"&gt;-&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: #cceeff;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 4px double; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 4px double; text-align: right"&gt;6,093&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="border-bottom: black 4px double;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; border-bottom: black 4px double"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 4px double; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 4px double;     <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;9. Revolving Credit Facility&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Our revolving credit facility&#13;provides for maximum borrowings of $30.0 million which is provided by the Bank of Oklahoma, National Association.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under&#13;the line of credit, there is one standby letter of credit totaling $0.9 million.&amp;#160; Borrowings available under the revolving&#13;credit facility at December 31, 2011, were $24.5 million.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Interest on borrowings is payable monthly at LIBOR plus 2.5%.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;No&#13;fees are associated with the unused portion of the committed amount.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of December 31, 2011 our outstanding balance&#13;under the revolving credit facility is $4.6 million and had no borrowings outstanding at December 31, 2010.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At December&#13;31, 2011 and 2010, the weighted average interest rate was 3.4% and 4.0%, respectively&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;At December 31, 2011, we were&#13;in compliance with our financial covenants. These covenants require that we meet certain parameters related to our tangible net&#13;worth, total liabilities to tangible net worth ratio and working capital.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At December 31, 2011 our tangible net worth&#13;was $122.5 million which meets the requirement of being at or above $95.0 million.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Our total liabilities to tangible&#13;net worth ratio were 0.46 to 1.0 which meets the requirement of not being above 2 to 1.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Our working capital was $45.7&#13;million which meets the requirement of being at or above $35.0 million.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;10. Fair Value Measurements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company determines the fair&#13;value of its financial instruments based on the fair value definition and hierarchy levels established in the guidance of ASC Topic&#13;820, &amp;#8216;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value Measurements and Disclosure&amp;#8217;&lt;/i&gt;.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Three levels are established within the hierarchy&#13;that may be used to measure fair value:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 1:&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Quoted prices&#13;(unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Level 1 assets and liabilities include exchange-traded&#13;derivative contracts, U.S. treasury securities and certain publicly traded equity securities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 2:&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Observable&#13;inputs, including Level 1 prices that have been adjusted; quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities; quoted prices in markets&#13;that are less active than traded exchanges; and other inputs that are observable or can be substantially corroborated by observable&#13;market data.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 3:&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Unobservable&#13;inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are a significant component of the fair value of the assets&#13;or liabilities. Valuation is generated from model-based techniques that use at least one significant assumption not observable&#13;in the market. These unobservable assumptions reflect estimates of assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the&#13;asset or liability.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Judgment is required in evaluating both quantitative and qualitative factors in the determination&#13;of significance for purposes of fair value level classification.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Level 3 amounts can include assets and liabilities&#13;whose value is determined using pricing models, discounted cash flow methodologies, or similar techniques, as well as assets and&#13;liabilities for which the determination of fair value requires significant management judgment or estimation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The lowest level of input that is a significant&#13;component of the fair value measurement determines the placement of the entire fair value measurement in the hierarchy. Our assessment&#13;of the significance of a particular input to the fair value measurement requires judgment, and may affect the valuation of the&#13;fair value of the financial instrument and its placement within the hierarchy level.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2011-01-01to2011-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;11.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The provision for income taxes&#13;consists of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: times new roman"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-weight: bold"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 51%; text-align: left; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;Current&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left; width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 12%; text-align: right"&gt;(2,594&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 2%; text-align: left"&gt;)&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 12%; text-align: right"&gt;10,241&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 2%; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; text-indent: 0pt; margin: 0; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Deferred income taxes reflect&#13;the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes&#13;and the amount used for income tax purposes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="text-align: left;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: #cceeff;
